ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course looks at a wide range of historical and contemporary approaches to Public Humanities. A variety of readings and speakers gives a broad overview of the current discourse and issues arising from the intersection of (and conflict between) academic thought and public consumption of humanities-based programming.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course helped me put my studies into a larger context, and sensitized me to the potential issues and possibilities in creating public programming. It might very well contribute to my dissertation.

I feel much more aware of the many different paths available to scholars in the academy and the various ways we can open dialogue across multiple boundaries--across disciplines and across the academy walls.
